page.title: 16Down by the Riverside
page.content: Down by the River Tay there are big boats and little boats. Some are fishing boats. Big boats go up and down the{River Tay}nearly every day. They come from all over United Kingdom taking goods to and from the harbour at{Perth}about 10 miles upstream. Every summer{salmon}come up the Tay to spawn. Some of the men from Newburgh work at the salmon fishing. In the middle of the River Tay there is a big island. Nearly every year People take cows across to it to graze in a boat called the Iron Duke. There is a small island called Kirwhaup. The River Tay is Scotland's longest river. When the tide is out there are many mudbanks which the boats have to avoid. The banks of the river have been built up to stop the fields from flooding during high tides.
